content.formatted_body:
does anyone know if there is precedent in platform apis for async factory functions for interfaces?

e.g

interface Foo {
  static Promise<Foo> create(DOMString url);
}

m.new_content.formatted_body:
does anyone know if there is precedent in platform apis for async factory functions for interfaces?

e.g

interface Foo {
  static Promise<Foo> create(DOMString url);
}

does anyone know if there is precedent in platform apis for async factory functions for interfaces?

e.g

interface Foo {
  static Promise<Foo> create(DOMString url);
};

content.body: Nothing wrong with such, if the resource does need to be async

> <@andreubotella:mozilla.org> I'm looking for a generally accessible article about how cross-origin cookies are unsafe and any changes that are planned in the future in that area.

https://github.com/sbingler/Origin-Bound-Cookies is probably of interest
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @andreubotella:mozilla.org
I'm looking for a generally accessible article about how cross-origin cookies are unsafe and any changes that are planned in the future in that area.
https://github.com/sbingler/Origin-Bound-Cookies is probably of interest

In reply to @lucacasonato:matrix.org

does anyone know if there is precedent in platform apis for async factory functions for interfaces?

e.g

interface Foo {
  static Promise<Foo> create(DOMString url);
};
There is a precedent I don't like, which is createImageBitmap(). I wish that had been ImageBitmap.create()

content.body: Other cases are usually more like "resource acquisition" so like `someParentResource.acquireThing()` returns a promise for a `Thing`. That feels OK to me. `createImageBitmap()` is the only straight-up async factory I can think of...
content.formatted_body: Other cases are usually more like "resource acquisition" so like someParentResource.acquireThing() returns a promise for a Thing. That feels OK to me. createImageBitmap() is the only straight-up async factory I can think of...

content.body: annevk, wanderview, or others: thoughts appreciated on best way to solve https://github.com/whatwg/infra/issues/402 and create good substring primitives for specs to use.
content.formatted_body: annevk, wanderview, or others: thoughts appreciated on best way to solve https://github.com/whatwg/infra/issues/402 and create good substring primitives for specs to use.

content.body: Is there any example of a spec using the current Fetch algo to fetch something? HTML and CSSOM both use, as far as I can tell, some pre-existing incompatible version of the algo that does something completely different.
apparently the compat spec build action timed out (like a month ago) - https://github.com/whatwg/compat/runs/3316480792
is there anyone who can re-kick that?
